alert.note: Alert for Cabell; Mason; Putnam (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 02 at 5:26AM EST by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 830 AM EST THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Portions of southeast Ohio and West Virginia, including the following counties, in southeast Ohio, Gallia, Lawrence and Meigs. In West Virginia, Cabell, Mason and Putnam. * WHEN...Until 830 AM EST. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations has been reported. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 522 AM EST, Mason County dispatch continued to report flooding of several secondary roads in the county. OHDOT also reports flooding of several roads ongoing in Lawrence and Gallia Counties. - Between 1 and 2 inches of rain has fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Huntington, Ashland, Ironton, Point Pleasant, Gallipolis, Coal Grove, Pomeroy, Rio Grande, Chesapeake, Rutland, Lake Vesuvius, Kenova, Ceredo, Buffalo, Mason, South Point, Russell, Vernon, Waterloo and Middleport.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
